Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system - Cricbuzz
summary:
Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system

Published on: Tue, Jan 7, 2025, 02:01 PM

Bangladesh batter Mominul Haque expressed his frustration over the proposed two-tier Test structure that could devalue the longer format of the game in Bangladesh.

  • Reports suggest the 'Big Three' (India, Australia, England) are in discussions to implement a two-division Test cricket structure.
  • The proposed system would be introduced after the current Future Tours Program ends in 2027.
  • Mominul is concerned about the potential reduction in the number of Test matches and the implications for player development.
  • The International Cricket Council is set to discuss the proposal with representatives from Australia and England.
  • Mominul emphasizes that playing against stronger teams is critical for the growth and improvement of Test cricket.
“It's frustrating for me. I am not sure whether we can progress to the first tier if we play well in the second tier... The value of Test cricket will go down if this happens.” - Mominul Haque

The conversation surrounding the two-tier system continues to raise concerns about the future of Test cricket and its impact on player development and the game's overall value.
newTitle: Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system

Eyewitness video captures destruction after powerful earthquake rocks Tibet - Hindustan Times
summary:
Powerful Earthquake in Tibet Captured on Eyewitness Video

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A powerful earthquake measuring 6.8 struck the foothills of the Himalayas near one of Tibet's holiest cities, resulting in 95 fatalities and numerous destroyed homes. Eyewitness video shared by Reuters showcases the extensive destruction, with rubble clogging the streets.

  • The epicenter was approximately 80 km north of Mount Everest.
  • Tremors also impacted neighboring countries, including Nepal, Bhutan, and India.
  • The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 km in Tingri county.
  • The Dalai Lama expressed his sorrow and prayers for victims.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with reports of significant damage and injuries.
“I offer my prayers for those who have lost their lives and extend my wishes for a swift recovery to all who have been injured.” - Dalai Lama

This earthquake adds to a historic pattern of seismic activity in the region, raising concerns for future occurrences.
newTitle: Powerful Earthquake in Tibet Captured on Eyewitness Video

title: OYO Results: Hotels chain operator earned ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024; Revenue drop 15% | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15%

Date & Source: March 2024, Live Mint

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt. Ltd. has reported a net profit for FY2024, despite a significant drop in operational revenue compared to the previous year.

  • The company reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, an improvement from the previous year's loss.
  • Operational revenue decreased by 15%, totaling ₹1,112.83 crore.
  • OYO achieved its first positive EBITDA since 2020, reported at ₹153 crore.
  • Total revenue for March 2024 was ₹1,179 crore, compared to ₹1,400 crore in the previous year.
  • OYO's first-ever post-tax profit was ₹229 crore, exceeding earlier profit projections.
  • Earnings per share improved to approximately ₹0.36 from a loss of ₹1.93 per share in FY23.
  • The company expanded its hotel portfolio significantly, growing inventory from 12,938 to 18,103 hotels.
“The company's reported profits for FY24 significantly exceeded CEO Ritesh Agarwal's earlier projection of ₹100 crore.”

In conclusion, OYO's financial recovery in FY2024 is notable, highlighting a turnaround amidst declining revenue but with an expansion in its hotel operations.
newTitle: OYO Hotels Reports ₹114.64 Crore Profit Despite Revenue Decline

Video captured from Space Station shows Earth bathed in intense green aurora - India Today
summary:
Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

Published On: Jan 7, 2025 | Source: India Today

Nasa astronaut Don Pettit has captivated audiences worldwide with a stunning video showcasing the vibrant green auroras from the International Space Station (ISS).

  • The video highlights the breathtaking natural light display caused by charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth’s magnetic field.
  • It emphasizes the beauty of this celestial spectacle as seen from space.
  • The video offers a rare glimpse of the auroras typically visible in high-latitude regions.
  • Pettit’s post was captioned “Flying over aurora; intensely green,” drawing admiration on social media.
  • The ISS orbits approximately 400 kilometers above Earth, providing unique documentation opportunities.
“Flying over aurora; intensely green.” - Don Pettit

This captivating video further showcases the incredible sights that can be witnessed beyond our atmosphere, illustrating the complexity of solar activity's impact on Earth's environment.
newTitle: Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

title: 'Lying, doesn’t want to offend Arvind Kejriwal': BJP shares PWD letter after Atishi's claim over being th - The Times of India
summary:
BJP Exposes Atishi's Claims on Eviction from Delhi CM House

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent dispute, the BJP released a letter from the Public Works Department (PWD) addressing claims made by AAP leader Atishi regarding her eviction from the Delhi Chief Minister's residence.

  • The BJP shared the PWD letter to counter Atishi's accusations.
  • Atishi alleges she was forcefully removed from the CM's official residence.
  • The BJP claims that the documentation proves her claims are unfounded.
“Lying, doesn’t want to offend Arvind Kejriwal,” BJP spokesperson stated regarding Atishi's remarks.

This incident has sparked debates about political accountability and transparency within the Delhi government.
newTitle: BJP Exposes Atishi's Claims on Eviction from Delhi CM House

title: HMPV virus cases live: No patients detected in Punjab, Nagpur; Officials urge ‘calm’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The recent outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) has raised concerns, but health officials in Punjab and Nagpur have reported no patients detected and are urging the public to remain calm.

  • Five HMPV cases were reported in various parts of India.
  • Health officials advise states to strengthen awareness and preventive measures.
  • Authorities confirm that HMPV is a common respiratory virus, not a new pathogen.
  • Children below three years and immunocompromised individuals are advised to exercise caution.
  • States like Odisha and Uttar Pradesh are increasing health department readiness.
“There is no need to panic, there is no such situation...so there is nothing to fear,” said Dr. Nilam Patel, Additional Director of Public Health in Gujarat.

Despite isolated cases, health officials emphasize the importance of public awareness and preparedness in dealing with respiratory illnesses.
newTitle: No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm

title: HMPV Virus Cases Live Updates: Tamil Nadu Health Secretary urges patients with severe lung infection to be cautious - The Financial Express
summary:
No Need to Panic Over HMPV Virus, Assures Kerala Health Minister

Date & Source: 7 January 2025, Financial Express

Kerala Health Minister Veena George has reassured the public about the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases detected in India, reporting a total of seven cases across several states. Health experts have emphasized that HMPV is not a new threat and encourages public vaccinations against flu and COVID-19 for immunity.

  • Seven confirmed cases of HMPV in India, with reports from Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, and Nagpur.
  • Health officials state that the public should not panic as HMPV is not a novel pathogen.
  • No specific antiviral therapy or vaccine available for HMPV, but flu and COVID-19 vaccinations may offer immunity.
  • Precautionary measures advised include wearing masks, regular hand washing, and avoiding close contact with sick individuals.
  • Children and the elderly, particularly those with co-morbidities, should take extra care.
“There is no need to panic, but increased caution is necessary.” - Sunita Tamta, Uttarakhand Medical Health Director

In conclusion, while monitoring and precautions are advised, health officials maintain that there is no cause for alarm regarding the HMPV situation in India.
newTitle: No Need to Panic Over HMPV Virus, Assures Kerala Health Minister

title: Atishi claims Centre 'snatched away' her official house; BJP says 'Delhi CM' lying - Hindustan Times
summary:
Atishi claims Centre 'snatched away' her official house; BJP says 'Delhi CM' lying

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi alleged that the central government cancelled her allotment of the CM residence just before the assembly elections. Her accusations were met with a rebuttal from the BJP, asserting she was lying.

  • Atishi claimed eviction by the BJP-led Central government from her official residence.
  • This incident occurred a day before the announcement of the Delhi assembly election schedule.
  • Atishi accused the BJP of undermining her position and efforts as CM.
  • BJP's Amit Malviya claimed Atishi hasn’t taken possession of her allotted residence, resulting in its retraction.
  • The Delhi assembly elections will take place on February 5, with results announced on February 8.
“But, I want to tell people of Delhi that the work won't stop even if they take away our home.” - Atishi

The recent conflict highlights the ongoing political tensions between the AAP and BJP, with implications for the upcoming elections.
newTitle: Atishi Accuses Centre of Evicting Her from Official Residence Ahead of Delhi Elections

Stock Market Today: BSE Sensex Ends Over 230 Points Up; Nifty50 Above 23,700

The Indian stock market witnessed a significant boost with the BSE Sensex closing over 230 points higher, while the Nifty50 crossed the 23,700 mark. Today's trading reflected strong investor confidence and positive economic indicators.

  • Nifty50 settled at 23,710.15, marking a gain of 75.00 points.

"Market sentiment remains bullish as investors are optimistic about the upcoming quarterly results, which are expected to show robust earnings growth." - Market Analyst

This upward trend in the stock market demonstrates resilience and positive movement amidst varying global economic conditions, suggesting a healthy outlook for Indian equities in the near future.

title: India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates - The Times of India
summary:
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

Date: October 2023 Source: Government of India

The government estimates indicate a slowdown in India’s GDP growth, projecting a 6.4% growth for FY25, a drop from 8.2% in the previous year.

  • The growth forecast reflects concerns over global economic conditions.
  • Policy adjustments may be necessary to stimulate economic activity.
  • Investments in infrastructure and manufacturing are seen as key areas for recovery.
"The economy is experiencing headwinds, but we remain focused on recovery through targeted investments and reforms." - Government official

In conclusion, India’s economy is navigating through challenges with proactive measures needed to ensure stability and growth.
newTitle: India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

title: Railway Safety Commissioner starts inspection of Udhampur-Baramulla rail link - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Railway Safety Commissioner Inspects Udhampur-Baramulla Rail Link

Date: January 07, 2024 Source: Jammu

The Commissioner of Railway Safety (Northern Circle), Dinesh Chand Deshwal, has initiated a two-day inspection of the newly completed Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Link (USBRL) project, marking a significant milestone towards connecting Kashmir with the rest of India.

  • The inspection coincides with the recent virtual inauguration of the Jammu Railway division by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the completion of the Reasi-Katra section last month, facilitating long-awaited connectivity.
  • Deshwal inspected the Katra-Reasi section and visited the Anji Khad bridge, India's first cable-stayed rail bridge.
  • The Commissioner plans to visit the Chenab River bridge in Kauri, the world's highest railway bridge.
  • Trial runs of electric trains on the Katra-Banihal section have been successfully conducted, indicating progress.
  • The USBRL project, started in 1997, faced delays due to challenging geological and meteorological conditions.
“The dream project to link Kashmir by train was started in 1997 and has missed several deadlines.”— Railway Officials

In conclusion, the inspection will evaluate the next steps for commencing train services to Kashmir after years of dedicated efforts.
newTitle: Railway Safety Commissioner Inspects Udhampur-Baramulla Rail Link

title: 'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal - The Times of India
summary:
'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal

Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

Nineteen-year-old Australian cricketer Sam Konstas addressed his on-field exchange with Jasprit Bumrah during the fifth Test, downplaying the incident that led to Usman Khawaja's dismissal.

  • The confrontation arose from Bumrah's frustration with Khawaja's perceived delay.
  • Umpires had to intervene during the on-field exchange.
  • Konstas admitted his role in the incident, stating, "It was probably my fault, but it happens. It's cricket."
  • He praised Bumrah's performance and acknowledged the team's overall strong showing.
  • Konstas expressed calmness during his Test debut, managing pressure through conversations with family and teammates.
  • His performance has raised expectations for his inclusion in the Sri Lanka tour squad.
“Credit to Bumrah. He got the wicket, but obviously, great performance from the team.”

In conclusion, Konstas reflects positively on his debut and the team's successes despite the on-field tensions.
newTitle: 'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal

title: Galaxy Unpacked on January 22: Samsung opens pre-reservations for S25 series in India - The Financial Express
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Pre-Reservations Open Ahead of Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Financial Express

Samsung has announced its next Unpacked event on January 22 in San Jose, California, where the new Galaxy S series will be launched. Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are now open in India.

Interested buyers in India can pre-reserve their units with a refundable token amount of Rs 2,000 to get exclusive launch offers and early access to the devices.

  • Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are live now across multiple platforms.
  • Customers pre-reserving will be eligible for benefits up to Rs 5,000.
  • The Galaxy S25 series is expected to feature Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chip and enhancements in design, display, and cameras.
  • Samsung's upcoming XR headset will also be unveiled during the launch event.
“Pre-reserved customers will be eligible for early access and receive benefits of up to Rs 5,000 on purchasing the new Galaxy S series devices,” Samsung said in a press release.

This event emphasizes Samsung's push towards integrating AI and extended reality in its products, marking a significant moment for the tech giant.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Pre-Reservations Open Ahead of Unpacked Event

Why is Delhi assembly election scheduled on Wednesday? CEC Rajiv Kumar explains - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi election dates: Voting will be held in all 70 constituencies on February 5, and counting of votes will take place on February 8.

Publication Date: January 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Election Commission of India has announced that voting for all 70 assembly constituencies in Delhi will occur on February 5, with results to be declared on February 8. Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar indicated that the decision to hold elections on a Wednesday aims to enhance voter participation.

  • Voting will take place across all constituencies on February 5.
  • Counting of votes is scheduled for February 8.
  • The final voter list includes 1,55,24,858 registered voters.
  • The last date for filing nominations is January 17, with scrutiny on January 18 and withdrawal on January 20.
“Date of polling is February 5 and counting is on 8. Again, we have deliberately kept voting on a Wednesday. We think all Delhi voters should cast their votes.” - CEC Rajiv Kumar

This election is expected to bolster voter turnout and reflect upon the electoral process's integrity, as emphasized by the Election Commission.
newTitle: Delhi Assembly Election Scheduled for February: CEC Rajiv Kumar Explains Voting Day Decision

title: Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation - Microsoft
summary:
Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Microsoft Stories India

Microsoft has announced a significant investment aimed at enhancing AI and cloud capabilities in India, emphasizing the importance of skilling and infrastructure development.

  • Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion in India for cloud and AI infrastructure over two years.
  • The goal is to train 10 million individuals in AI skills by 2030.
  • Establishment of new datacenters to support growing AI needs in India.
“India is rapidly becoming a leader in AI innovation, unlocking new opportunities across the country.” - Satya Nadella

This investment sets the stage for India to become an AI-first nation while fostering innovation and entrepreneurship across various sectors.
newTitle: Microsoft's $3 Billion Investment to Boost AI and Cloud Infrastructure in India

title: CES 2025: Nvidia announces RTX 50 Series GPUs with 2x performance boost and DLSS 4.0 - The Times of India
summary:
CES 2025: Nvidia Announces RTX 50 Series GPUs with Major Performance Improvements

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Tech News Today

At CES 2025, Nvidia unveiled its latest RTX 50 Series GPUs, promising a significant performance boost of up to 2x compared to the previous generation, alongside the introduction of DLSS 4.0 technology.

  • Nvidia's RTX 50 Series GPUs achieve a 2x performance increase over RTX 40 Series.
  • New DLSS 4.0 technology enhances frame rates and image quality in games.
  • The RTX 50 GPUs utilize advanced manufacturing processes for improved efficiency.
  • Nvidia expects the new GPUs to set a new standard in gaming and professional graphics.
"This is a transformative leap in GPU technology, enabling gamers to experience unprecedented performance and visual fidelity." - Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang

Overall, the introduction of the RTX 50 Series GPUs positions Nvidia as a leader in the graphics card market, ensuring that gamers and professionals alike can benefit from cutting-edge technology.
newTitle: CES 2025: Nvidia Announces RTX 50 Series GPUs with Major Performance Improvements

title: Fastag To Be Mandatory For All Vehicles In Maharashtra From April 1, 2025 - Pune Pulse
